name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Arkansas research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Arkansas ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for arkansas ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for arkansas research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Arkansas research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Arkansas Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Arkansas research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Arkansas Overview—3:18

  3. Follow this research study for Arkansas ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Arkansas Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Arkansas research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Arkansas Resources
    ☆ AC—Arkansas State Research Guide

  5. Record Finder: Use the Arkansas Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Arkansas Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Arkansas in these articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Arkansas
      ☆ AG—Arkansas African American Records

    2. Explore the African American Gateway for Arkansas.
    3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Arkansas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Arkansas

    Exercises
    • * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
    • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Arkansas in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Arkansas
    ☆ AG—Arkansas African American Records

  2. Explore the African American Gateway for Arkansas.
  3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Arkansas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Arkansas

1. Explore Arkansas historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Arkansas History

  2. Explore Arkansas history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Arkansas

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Arkansas archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Arkansas archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Arkansas archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Arkansas Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Arkansas State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Arkansas.
  3. Explore records from the Arkansas State Archives collection.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Arkansas.
  5. Explore resources in the ☆Encyclopedia of Arkansas site.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Arkansas genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on arkansas research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find arkansas ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Arkansas city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Arkansas Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Arkansas city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Arkansas city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Arkansas ☆historical directories by county.

hidden.summary:

  4. Explore Arkansas birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Arkansas vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Arkansas research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Arkansas County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Arkansas.

text:
1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Arkansas Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Arkansas research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Arkansas Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Arkansas Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Arkansas Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. Visit Arkansas Genealogy - Just Ask!

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Arkansas research.
  2. Explore the Arkansas research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Arkansas research.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Arkansas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Arkansas Societies
  2. Learn about genealogy societies in Arkansas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Arkansas Societies

  3. Explore the Arkansas Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore Arkansas genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Arkansas.
